sentences.en: "I ought to reconsider her offer to move in," he mused.
sentences.cn: “我该重新考虑她让我搬去和她一起住的提议，”他思忖着。

sentences.en: "This ought to be fun," he told Alex, eyes gleaming.
sentences.cn: “这应该会很有趣！”他对亚历克斯说,两眼闪闪发光.

sentences.en: All of us ought to go.
sentences.cn: 我们大家都应该去。

sentences.en: Basically the system ought to have worked.
sentences.cn: 其实这套系统本应发挥作用的。

sentences.en: Do you think I ought to seal the boxes up?
sentences.cn: 你认为我应该把这些盒子封起来吗?

sentences.en: He ought to have reached the house some time ago.
sentences.cn: 他应该早就到房子那儿了。

sentences.en: I realize I ought to have told you about it.
sentences.cn: 我意识到我本该告诉你这件事的。

sentences.en: I think I ought to cut in on what they are doing.
sentences.cn: 我认为对他们现在干的事我应当进行干预。

sentences.en: I think I ought to get back to work.
sentences.cn: 我想我该回去工作了。

sentences.en: I think you ought to give football a rest for a time.
sentences.cn: 我认为你应该暂时停止踢足球。

sentences.en: If we all stick together, we ought to be okay.
sentences.cn: 如果我们大家团结在一起，就不会有事。

sentences.en: If you're sexually harassed, you ought to do something about it.
sentences.cn: 如果遭到了性骚扰，你应该采取行动。

sentences.en: It ought to make life much easier all round.
sentences.cn: 它应该会让生活的方方面面都变得更加方便。

sentences.en: Mark, you've got a good wife. You ought to take care of her.
sentences.cn: 马克，你娶了个好太太，应该好好照顾她啊。

sentences.en: She wondered if she ought to take some coffee out to Alfred.
sentences.cn: 她不知道自己是否应该给艾尔弗雷德端去咖啡。

sentences.en: The money to build the power station ought to have been sufficient.
sentences.cn: 建设电站的资金本该足够了。

sentences.en: This place is run like a hotel ought to be run.
sentences.cn: 这个地方的经营方式就是旅馆应该有的样子.

sentences.en: We ought to check him out on the computer.
sentences.cn: 我们理应在电脑上查清他的资料。

sentences.en: You know, we really ought to get another car.
sentences.cn: 要知道，我们真的应该换一辆车了。

sentences.en: You ought to be ashamed of your foolish behaviour.
sentences.cn: 你应当为自己的愚蠢行为而感到羞耻。

sentences.en: You ought to be ashamed of yourselves. You've created this problem.
sentences.cn: 你们应该感到惭愧，都是你们惹的祸。

sentences.en: You ought to be careful about this kind of feverish cold, it often kicks back when you think you are better.
sentences.cn: 你应当对这种有发烧症状的感冒小心些，它常常在你以为好转的时候复发。

sentences.en: You ought to channel your abilities into something useful.
sentences.cn: 你应当把你的才能用到有用的事情上。

trans.tran_en: You use ought to to mean that it is morally right to do a particular thing or that it is morally right for a particular situation to exist, especially when giving or asking for advice or opinions.
it is morally right to do a particular thing or that it is morally right for a particular situation to exist, especially when giving or asking for advice or opinions.
You use ought to have with a past participle to indicate that although it was best or correct for someone to do something in the past, they did not actually do it.
